comment._content: COUSIN SAYS BEATTIE ADMITTED MURDER; " I Wish I Hadn't Done It," Witness Declares Defendant Told Him After His Wife Was Killed. August 29, 1911, Tuesday Page 1, 3351 words CHESTERFIELD COURT HOUSE, Va., Aug. 28. -- Showing intense emotion, Paul D. Beattie, cousin of Henry Clay Beattie, Jr., who is on trial here for the murder of his wife, declared on the witness stand late to-day that the defendant told him twenty-four hours after the murder that he was sorry "he had done it," a circumstance relating to the crime that the witness hitherto had suppressed. In another article about this case, another witness is justice of the peace Jacobs. BEATTIE WITNESS HEARD GIRL SCREAM; This Was Followed by a Gunshot, Man Living Near Place of Wife's Murder Testifies. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C04EFDB1531E233A...
